body:
### Description

My nvim starts to reporting that the manager.lua:290 attempt to index local 'self' (a number value) for all three of my language servers. After I commented out the following config lines, the report is off:

The logs are simply showing **successfully installed/upgraded the language servers**.

```
lsp_installer.on_server_ready(function(server)
	local opts = {
		on_attach = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.handlers").on_attach,
		capabilities = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.handlers").capabilities,
	}

	 if server.name == "lua_ls" then
		local lua_ls_opts = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.settings.lua_ls")
		opts = vim.tbl_deep_extend("force", lua_ls_opts, opts)
	 end

	 if server.name == "pyright" then
		local pyright_opts = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.settings.pyright")
		opts = vim.tbl_deep_extend("force", pyright_opts, opts)
	 end

	 if server.name == "texlab" then
		local tex_lab_opts = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.settings.texlab")
		opts = vim.tbl_deep_extend("force", tex_lab_opts, opts)
	 end
end)
```

### Neovim version

NVIM v0.9.1
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3

### Nvim-lspconfig version

_No response_

### Operating system and version

macOS 13.5.1 (22G90)

### Affected language servers

lua pyright texlab

### Steps to reproduce

Didn't do anything about it.

### Actual behavior

error messages for lspconfig on steup the servers.

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Minimal config

```Lua
lsp_installer.on_server_ready(function(server)
	local opts = {
		on_attach = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.handlers").on_attach,
		capabilities = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.handlers").capabilities,
	}

	 if server.name == "lua_ls" then
		local lua_ls_opts = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.settings.lua_ls")
		opts = vim.tbl_deep_extend("force", lua_ls_opts, opts)
	 end

	 if server.name == "pyright" then
		local pyright_opts = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.settings.pyright")
		opts = vim.tbl_deep_extend("force", pyright_opts, opts)
	 end

	 if server.name == "texlab" then
		local tex_lab_opts = require("lsp-config.lsp-installer.settings.texlab")
		opts = vim.tbl_deep_extend("force", tex_lab_opts, opts)
	 end
end)
```
```


### LSP log

title: lspconfig not working
